definition: to go on an official or business trip

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]
to send/to commission/messenger/mission

sentences.english: Whenever he is on a business trip, he takes a cup with him, which is convenient and hygienic.
sentences.chinese: 他出差的時候總是自己帶一個口杯，方便也乾淨。

sentences.english: You may get the chance to travel both for work and for pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 你有出差的機會，同時也可以遊山玩水。

sentences.english: Are you working outstation in NanJing?
I travel with my job and enjoy visiting new countries and learning new cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我經常出差，喜歡參觀沒去過的國家中，學習新文化。

sentences.english: I do not use travel as an excuse for anything.
sentences.chinese: 我不會用出差作爲任何事情的藉口。

sentences.english: I came on business before, but this time I'm here to sightsee .
sentences.chinese: 我以前是來出差的，但是這一次是來觀光的。

sentences.english: If Beijing hao's travel, work overtime and put YangManLi children home.
sentences.chinese: 假如郝京妮加班和出差，孩子就放楊曼莉家。

sentences.english: P1: It's Tom. I am in Los Angeles on business trip at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 我的Tom啊，我現在正在洛杉磯出差。

sentences.english: Q oes the frequent travel required for this work fit into your lifestyle?
sentences.chinese: 經常需要出差的工作適合你的生活方式嗎？

sentences.english: I next business trip in Wuhan.
sentences.chinese: 我接下來會在武漢出差。

sentences.english: An anonymoustrader commented that the computer might have gone ahead and processed, something of an error happened there.
sentences.chinese: 一個匿名交易人說電腦可能出差錯了。

sentences.english: When we go on a business trip, we will be faced with the choice of traveling by train orby plane.
sentences.chinese: 當我們出差，我們將面臨的選擇乘坐火車或飛機。

sentences.english: The salesman padded the bill for his travelling expenses by exaggerating his food expenses.
sentences.chinese: 推銷員誇大伙食費的開支來虛報出差費。

sentences.english: Willing and able to travel frequently to Europe and take domicile in Beihai, Guangxi.
sentences.chinese: 能夠常駐在廣西北海並能適應經常去歐洲出差。

sentences.english: Willing to travel extensively and work on a home-office base.
sentences.chinese: 適應經常出差，接受在家辦公的工作。

sentences.english: Save money on trips by staying with friends or relatives.
sentences.chinese: 出差時住在親朋好友家可以節省費用。

definition: to go back to one's roots/to return to one's native place/by ext. to join one's ancestors (i.e. to die)
to go to work/to be on duty/to start work/to go to the office
to request leave of absence
to go home to visit one's family
to finish work/to get off work
to take a vacation/to go on holiday
to work overtime
to take the car, bus, train etc
colleague/co-worker/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
parts of the country other than where one is
social niceties/social interaction/a dinner party
to make a trip home
to leave early and return late (idiom)
to hold a meeting/to attend a meeting
to make a telephone call
to return home
